text.more:
Similar nodes (theses) are located close to each other in the network. Most of the similar nodes have the same colour which meaning that they belong to the same cluster. This shows some similarities with the results found by using SOM and Ward even though the network was based only in three of eight topics. Above is described each cluster to guide the user:
********************************************************************************************************************************************************************* 
Cluster 0 (Slightly desaturated cyan): It is not characterized by a specific topic; Most of the theses in this cluster are from “Knowledge Management and Business Intelligence”, “Information Analysis and Management”, “Data Science and Advanced Analytics”, “Information Systems and Technologies Management”, “Knowledge Management and Business Intelligence”, “Risk Analysis and Management”, “Law and Financial Markets”, “Marketing Intelligence” and “Marketing Research and CRM”. 
********************************************************************************************************************************************************************* 
Cluster 1 (Soft red): It is characterized by the topic “Land_cover/GIS/Geospatial/Maps/Urbanism/Cities”; Most of the theses in this cluster are from “Geospatial Technologies”, “Geographic Information Systems and Science”. Theses in this cluster have many connections with other theses. 
********************************************************************************************************************************************************************* 
Cluster 2 ( Dark moderate lime green): It is characterized by the topic “Health Management Education” Most of the theses in this cluster are from “Clinical Research Management”. 
********************************************************************************************************************************************************************* 
Cluster 3 (Dark moderate magenta): It is characterized by the “Busines_Intelligence_&_Process/Knowledge_Management/Organizations; Most of the theses in this cluster are from “Knowledge Management and Business Intelligence” and “Information Systems and Technologies Management”. 
********************************************************************************************************************************************************************* 
Cluster 4 (Very light yellow): It is characterized by the topic “GA/GP/GSGP/Machine_Learning_algorithms”; Most of the theses in this cluster are from “Data science and advanced Analytics”.
text.intro:
The number displayed on each node 
represents the ID of each thesis. 
*******************************************************
Information about the author, the supervisor, the title, the type, the URL, the Course/Specialization, the token numbers, the score readability, the cluster label and the topic distributions of each thesis, was embedded. 
******************************************************* 
The colour intensity on edges indicates how strong is the connection from one node to another. 
******************************************************* 
The node size indicates how many connection the thesis has. 
******************************************************* 
Each colour node represents a cluster label found by using SOM and Ward. 
******************************************************* 
Cluster 0: Slightly desaturated cyan; Cluster 1: Soft red; Cluster 2: Dark moderate lime green; Cluster 3: Dark moderate magenta; Cluster 4: Very light yellow;  
******************************************************* 
The network layout is Yifan Hu Proportional. 
******************************************************* 
Click on "More about this visualisation" to see information about each cluster
text.title: Network TD-SOM: Clusters and interlinkages of the Masters theses from Nova IMS (Using the topic vectors from BERTopic)
